problems_validated.problem: Writing effective AI prompts takes too much time and effort, creating a trade-off between speed and quality
problems_validated.severity: High - described as 'frustrating trade-off' that makes neither option acceptable for business use
problems_validated.current_solutions: Manual back-and-forth prompting with ChatGPT, spending hours crafting individual prompts
problems_validated.market_gap: No systematic approach for creating production-grade prompts quickly and consistently

problems_solutions.problem: Prompts that work in casual ChatGPT conversations fail in production environments
problems_solutions.solution: Use single-shot prompting approach with systematic PDER process
steps: Plan - define what prompt needs to do
Draft - use AI tool to generate initial prompt
Refine - make targeted improvements and repeat

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Skipping the planning phase before writing prompts
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Wasting time on ineffective prompts that don't meet requirements
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Always clearly define what the prompt needs to do before writing
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Most people jump straight into writing without planning

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Using markdown instead of XML for system prompts with user input
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Use XML tags around user input and reference them explicitly
